TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/TreeView/Glyph extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for the plus sign (+) and minus sign (-) buttons of a tree view control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The properties of the VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph class get a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for the plus sign and minus sign buttons that display next to a tree view node that contains child elements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TreeView.Glyph.Opened%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewGlyph1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_16_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_16_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a minus sign (-) button of a tree view node.
Docs.value: A that represents a minus sign button of a tree view node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Closed property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Closed property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewGlyph2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#321](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_105_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#321](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_105_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a plus sign (+) button of a tree view node.
Docs.value: A that represents a plus sign button of a tree view node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Opened property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Opened property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTreeViewGlyph1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_20_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#320](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_20_1.vb)]
